content.text: On Fig. 1.1, the labels W, X, Y and Z show the points when the car's motion changed

Fig. 1.2
Calculate the distance that the car travels between 60s and 100s
distance travelled = .........m
Fig. 1.1 shows that the car's acceleration is greater than its deceleration
Explain how the graph shows this
Fig. 1.1 shows the speed-time graph for a car
The average mass of each log is \(65.0kg.\)
Calculate the total weight of the raft
total weight of the raft = .........N
The mass of one of the logs is \(66.0kg.\) It is \(3.0m\) long and has a cross sectional area of \(0.040m^2.\)
Calculate the density of the wood in the log
density = .........$kg/m^3$
Explain why the log in (b)(i) floats on water
[Total: 7]
Fig. 2.1 shows a wooden raft. The raft is made from 8 logs
The logs are all of the same type of wood
The man applies a force of \(150\mathrm{N}\) at a distance of \(0.50\mathrm{m}\) from the pivot
Calculate the moment of this force about the pivot. Include a unit
The force applied by the man produces a turning effect (moment) about the pivot
Describe another example of using the turning effect of a force
The man tries to use the metal bar to remove another nail from the piece of wood. He applies the same force of \(150\mathrm{N}\) at a distance of \(0.50\mathrm{m}\) from the pivot
The turning effect produced is not enough to remove this nail from the piece of wood
Describe how the man can increase the turning effect without increasing the force
[Total: 6]
A man uses a metal bar to remove an iron nail from a piece of wood, as shown in Fig. 3.1
Fig. 4.2 shows the thermometer used in Fig. 4.1
State the temperature shown on the thermometer
temperature = .........Â°C
The thermometer shown in Fig. 4.2 uses a physical property that changes with temperature
Indicate the measurable property that changes with temperature. Tick **one** box
Thermal energy (heat) transfers through the bottom of the beaker to the water
State the name given to this process
Thermal energy transfers throughout the water in the beaker
Describe and explain how this happens
A Bunsen burner heats a beaker of water, as shown in Fig. 4.1
Use the grid to determine the focal length of the lens
focal length = .........cm
On Fig. 5.1, draw a ray from the top of the object that passes through a principal focus, then through the lens and beyond it

On Fig. 5.1, draw an arrow to show the position and nature of the image produced by the lens. [2]

Fig. 5.1 represents an object positioned on the principal axis of a thin lens
Each small square of the grid represents 0.5cm. Each principal focus of the lens is labelled F
Describe how the thermal energy is used to generate electricity
Describe two environmental problems that are due to using nuclear power stations
[Total: 5]
Nuclear fission is used in nuclear power stations to release thermal energy
In Fig. 7.1, one part of the electromagnetic spectrum is not labelled
State the name of this part
The speed of visible light waves in a vacuum is \(3.0 \times 10^{8} \text{m/s}\)
Suggest a value for the speed of infra-red waves in a vacuum
Some parts of the electromagnetic spectrum have a wavelength shorter than that of visible light
State one example
X-rays and \(\gamma\) -rays are used in hospitals
Describe one medical use for X-rays and one use for \(\gamma\) -rays
X-rays
Î³-rays

Fig. 7.1 shows some parts of the electromagnetic spectrum

Sound is produced when a source
Sound waves cannot travel through a

State the highest frequency of sound that can be heard by elephants

[Total: 8]
Humans, elephants, mice and dolphins have different hearing ranges. Fig. 8.1 shows the hearing range for each type of animal
The current in the wires of the circuit is a flow of particles
Indicate the name of these particles. Tick one box
electrons
atoms
protons
Calculate the combined resistance of the two resistors
resistance = .........$\Omega$
Calculate the potential difference (p.d.) reading that would be shown on the voltmeter
potential difference (p.d.) = .........V
Fig. 9.1 shows a simple circuit
The circuit is changed
The two resistors are connected in parallel

State the type of charge on the rod
Explain your answer
Fig. 10.1 shows a balloon hanging from an insulating thread
Electrical charges can move easily through some materials
Draw a circle around each material that charges can move through easily
copper plastic rubber silver wood

2. State the term given to part P

When there are ....................... turns in the primary coil than in Q, the device is called a
transformer. [1]
The high-voltage transmission of electricity uses transformers

Fig. 11.1 represents a transformer
The nuclide notation \(^A_2X\) describes the nucleus of one type of atom
Draw a line from each symbol to the correct description for that symbol
One radioactive isotope has a half-life of 6.0 years
A sample of this isotope has a mass of \(12 \text{mg}\)
Calculate the mass of this isotope that remains in the sample after 18 years
mass remaining = .........mg
The sample decays by emitting a \(\beta\) -particle
Describe the nature of a \(\beta\) -particle
